availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. Wray (Calloway Co, Hickman Co., bricklayer and farmer)

body.p: Calloway County and Hickman County, Kentucky, bricklayer and farmer. Tennessee native. Married to Celia Ward Wray in Calloway County, Kentucky, on November 6, 1839. Father of Frances Wray, William Wray, John Wray, James Wray, Hardin Wray, and Esma Wray. Bricklayer in Calloway County in 1850. Farmer in Clinton in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Clinton in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Calloway County, District 2, p. 409B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 515.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hickman County, Clinton, p. 200B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Calloway County Marriages, Film #001942719, p. 174.
